column3: Um any of you who find that you really enjoy storytelling I would like to mention that the last weekend in July H In Spring Grove Illinois there is a festival H children under twelve are free PAR I'll just mention that to all you parents PAR H Um and it's called the Illinois storytelling festival Have any of you ever gone I know you have Alright

Put your hand down H Uh When I found out I was telling here I didn't realize that Dusty had attended your church a number of times he's also a storyteller uh H from the Illinois storytelling festival H And uh we would love to have you all come There are four tents a children's tent H an adult tent H a general tent and then a traditions tent Where everyone can come and just share their memories of growing up or H world war whatever or H f first time you ever rode in a train all of those things it's a wonderful family event And I hope that some of you would be able to come

The next story that I have is from the Native Americans H It's called how the stars got in the sky Did you ever wonder how the stars got in the sky This is the way the Indians think that the stars got in the sky H And I learned this story from a white man who had been adopted into a tribe in Michigan In Wisconsin he has taken on all of the Native American ways And the people thought so much of him that they have given him uh also a Native American name And he gave me permission to tell the story H Long ago in the sky there was only the sun and the moon H And on the nights when the moon didn't shine it was very dark Indeed H Well all of the animals got together H and decided they were going to go to the creator To see if he could help with the problem Well when they arrived the creator said I will help you but first you must do something H All of you are to go down to the lake And gather stones H Now not round stones like the moon but jagged stones H And when you have got as many as you can carry H bring them to me and then MRC I will help you MRC And so all the animals went to the lake All except coyote Because L coyote was lazy L

And he was asleep H So all the animals gathered as many stones as they could carry the large animals had a great many stones H And the little animals like grasshopper and bumblebee they could only carry one
H But they all brought them to the feet of the creator L All except coyote Because he was lazy and
he was asleep L H So the creator looked over all the stones that were brought H and chose one Not too large

H and reached up H and placed it in the sky And when he did it began to twinkle And he said H this I will call a star And this one a special star A homing star H The North Star H And this evening all of you animals are going to go off the edge of the Earth into the sky to make your pictures With stars And so that evening all of the animals gathered their stones and they MRC walked off the edge of the world MRC Into the sky To make their pictures H With the brilliant dots that would turn into stars They all went except coyote TSK Because he was lazy And he was asleep H Well after all the animals had gone H the creator called to coyote

H VOX this great big bag of stones into the sky VOX and when any of the other animals need them then you give them the extras that they need

Into the sky H Well he hadn't gone very far
when that bag started to feel very heavy H And so he looked one way

And he looked the other way And then he put that bag down VOX and he VOX dug in again Flung one paw full of stones one way H one the other way and no one had seen him But the sky was getting brighter behind him H He put that bag right up back on his back

walked a little further Well it felt good for about a minute or two and then lazy coyote he just couldn't stand it anymore L He looked one way he looked the other L then he put that bag down opened it real wide and like a puppy digging a hole he just dug all of those stones H right out of that bag until he got right down to the bottom And all those stones H started sparkling behind him Then he took that bag made sure it was empty folded it up made a little pillow pulled up a comfortable cloud laid down and went to sleep Well pretty soon the animals were running out of stones they started calling VOX coyote we need some more stones over here right over where are you coyote VOX Well

coyote didn't hear them Because he was lazy and he was asleep WH Well WH the first rays of morning started peeking over the edge of the Earth H and all the animals had to scurry back onto the Earth Before day broke Some of them had to leave their pictures half done Some had only had one stone They could just put up in the sky H A few were finished like the swan and finally when a ray of light hit coyote in the eye he woke up and he realized he too had to hurry back onto Earth So he did But that night MRC when he looked up at the sky MRC that's when he learned how to howl Because he saw L all the other animals with their pictures in the sky L and MRC his wasn't there MRC Because he'd been lazy And he had been asleep And that's the story of how all the stars got in the sky

Thank you very much Um there are a couple of other storytelling events that I'd just like to share with you one is in Elgin tomorrow evening Jim May is going to be um doing some stories H uh for a church group there and you It's a public uh occasion and you'd all be welcome I'll leave some fliers for you here if you'd like them H And uh next Saturday H at the McHenry County Conservation District which isn't really all that far H Um Rosalee Sorrells who is a well-known folk singer and storyteller will be doing a program H and at seven-thirty and you'd all be welcome to come We'd love to have you there So I thank you very much if any of you have occasions to use storytellers I'd be happy to talk with you or to find you an appropriate storyteller for H any other group you might belong to Thank you very much
